description: The QPLANT shall be capable to operate uninterrupted in 2K mode for at least 90 consecutive days
full_description: The QPLANT shall be capable to operate uninterrupted in 2K mode for at least 90 consecutive days

description: The maintenance schedule shall take into account the following constraints: ≥ 6 months: ≤ 10 days in 2K standby; ≥ 1 year: ≤ 20 days in 4.5K standby; ≥ 5 years: ≤ 60 days in warm stop; ≥ 10 years: ≤ 120 days in warm stop
full_description: The maintenance schedule shall take into account the following constraints: ≥ 6 months: ≤ 10 days in 2K standby; ≥ 1 year: ≤ 20 days in 4.5K standby; ≥ 5 years: ≤ 60 days in warm stop; ≥ 10 years: ≤ 120 days in warm stop
acceptance_criteria: Value shall meet 6 m; Value shall meet 10 ; Temperature condition: 2K

description: The QPLANT shall have a lifetime of at least 40 years
full_description: The QPLANT shall have a lifetime of at least 40 years
rationale: Required to meet project lifetime objectives

description: The QPLANT shall support ≥ 50 warm-up/cool-down cycles (300 K ↔ 2 K)
full_description: The QPLANT shall support ≥ 50 warm-up/cool-down cycles (300 K ↔ 2 K)
acceptance_criteria: Value shall meet 50 wa; Temperature condition: 300K; Temperature condition: 2K

description: The QPLANT shall support the steady state operational scenarios: Warm Stop, Thermal Shield Standby, 4.5 K Standby, 2 K Standby, 2 K Operation
full_description: The QPLANT shall support the steady state operational scenarios: Warm Stop, Thermal Shield Standby, 4.5 K Standby, 2 K Standby, 2 K Operation
acceptance_criteria: Temperature condition: 4.5K; Temperature condition: 2K; Temperature condition: 2K
rationale: Required for proper operational flexibility and system control

description: The QPLANT shall support the scenario transitions given in Figure 6
full_description: The QPLANT shall support the scenario transitions given in Figure 6
rationale: Required for proper operational flexibility and system control

description: The QPLANT shall execute the transition using the capacity defined by the steady state scenarios. No additional capacity shall be added solely for acceleration of state transitions
full_description: The QPLANT shall execute the transition using the capacity defined by the steady state scenarios. No additional capacity shall be added solely for acceleration of state transitions
rationale: Required to meet operational performance targets

description: The QPLANT shall perform the cool-down of the QPLANT simultaneously with the cryogenic users (QCELL and QDIST static heat loads only)
full_description: The QPLANT shall perform the cool-down of the QPLANT simultaneously with the cryogenic users (QCELL and QDIST static heat loads only)

description: The QPLANT shall facilitate parallel cool down/warm up of all QCELLs. During cooldown and warm-up, cryomodules impose constraints: Magnetic shields must reach T < 70 K before cavities reach T < 10 K
full_description: The QPLANT shall facilitate parallel cool down/warm up of all QCELLs. During cooldown and warm-up, cryomodules impose constraints: Magnetic shields must reach T < 70 K before cavities reach T < 10 K

description: The QPLANT shall facilitate an alternative cooldown in which only the thermal-shield (TS) circuit is cooled until their average temperature reaches 50 K. Subsequently the headers A–B and D–E are simultaneous cooled down
full_description: The QPLANT shall facilitate an alternative cooldown in which only the thermal-shield (TS) circuit is cooled until their average temperature reaches 50 K. Subsequently the headers A–B and D–E are simultaneous cooled down

description: The QPLANT shall facilitate the warm-up of the cryogenic users from 2 K to 300 K in less than 5 days
full_description: The QPLANT shall facilitate the warm-up of the cryogenic users from 2 K to 300 K in less than 5 days
acceptance_criteria: Temperature condition: 2K; Temperature condition: 300K; Value shall meet 5

description: The QPLANT shall support the transition shown in Figure 6 for the warming-up of the cryogenic users, whether passively or actively (with QCELL heaters if available)
full_description: The QPLANT shall support the transition shown in Figure 6 for the warming-up of the cryogenic users, whether passively or actively (with QCELL heaters if available)

description: The Contractor may implement a manual purging, manual conditioning, and manual initial preparation of the QPLANT
full_description: The Contractor may implement a manual purging, manual conditioning, and manual initial preparation of the QPLANT

description: The QPLANT shall adhere to the purge-parameter table (pressure, flow-rate, duration, allowable residual O₂) provided by SCK CEN during contract execution
full_description: The QPLANT shall adhere to the purge-parameter table (pressure, flow-rate, duration, allowable residual O₂) provided by SCK CEN during contract execution
rationale: Required for safe operation of cryogenic system

description: The QPLANT shall facilitate an average retention rate of 0.8 g/s LHe per individual QCELL (24 g/s total) during the filling process
full_description: The QPLANT shall facilitate an average retention rate of 0.8 g/s LHe per individual QCELL (24 g/s total) during the filling process
acceptance_criteria: Value shall meet 0.8 g; Value shall meet 24 g

description: During LHe filling, the QPLANT shall provide 2,900 L of LHe to the users
full_description: During LHe filling, the QPLANT shall provide 2,900 L of LHe to the users
acceptance_criteria: Value shall meet 2 ; Value shall meet 900
